title: Scenario: Basic Player information
custom_preconds:
Given
The URL of the page is wap.milb.com/player/<player_id>
custom_steps:
When
The page is scrolled to the top
custom_expected:
Then
The player full name should be displayed which should match name_display_full
and
the team name should be displayed next which should match team_name
and
their number should match jersey_number (if applicable) 
and
the position should match primary_position
and
their status should match status
and
MLB parent club should match organization

title: Scenario: Player Buttons
custom_preconds:
Given
The url of the page is wap.milb.com/player/<player_id>
custom_steps:
When
The page is scrolled to the middle section
custom_expected:
Then
There should be two buttons (Bio, Stats)

title: Scenario: Bio Button
custom_preconds:
Given
The url of the page is wap.milb.com/player/<player_id>
custom_steps:
When
The Bio button is clicked on
custom_expected:
Then
The url remains unchanged
and
the players full name matches name_display_full
and
born matches birthdate
and
birthplace matches birth_place
and
height matches  height
and
weight matches weight
and
bats matches bats
and 
throws matches throws
and 
college matches college UNLESS the player did not attend college in which case it will appear as ---

title: Scenario: Stats Button type of stats
custom_preconds:
Given
The url of the page is wap.milb.com/player/<player_id>
custom_steps:
When
The stats button is clicked on
custom_expected:
Then
The URL will change to wap.milb.com/player/<player_id>/stats such that <player_id> is equal to the <player_id> from given
and
below the buttons there will be a line of text in the form of <year> <typeOfStat> stats. If the season is in play it will have the current seasons year, if the current is the offseason then it will have the prior year and the typeOfStat will correspond to if the player is a pitcher or not. If the player is a pitcher it will say pitching and if the player is not a pitcher it will say hitting.
UNLESS the player was both a pitcher and also has hitting stats then they will have two rows of data (each respective to each stat) - they will have <year> Pitching Stats and <year> Hitting Stats

title: Scenario: Stats button contents
custom_steps:
When
The page is scrolled to view the stats
custom_expected:
Then
Each team the player played for should have its own line.
and 
pitchers should show the following stats (W-L, ERA, SV, G, IP, SO)
and 
non-pitchers should show the following stats (G, AB, HR, RBI, AVG, OBP, SLG)
and 
if the player both pitched and hit they should have both sections
